0.text: Bug 394234  Invalid StackMapTable generated in Java 7.

1.text: When compiling for Java 7, AspectJ can compute an invalid StackMapTable.

2.text: The verifier will throw a ClassNotFoundException when the generated class is loaded.

3.text: Example: class Parent<T> {} class ChildA<T> extends Parent<T> {} class ChildB<T> extends Parent<T> {}  public Object methodWithBadStackMapTable(boolean value) { 	return value ?

4.text: new ChildA<String>() : new ChildB<String>(); }  javap shows the computed StackMapTable to be: StackMapTable: number_of_entries = 2    frame_type = 15 /* same */    frame_type = 71 /* same_locals_1_stack_item */   stack = [ class "Parent<T>" ]  when it should be: StackMapTable: number_of_entries = 2    frame_type = 15 /* same */    frame_type = 71 /* same_locals_1_stack_item */   stack = [ class Parent ]
